text: (December 28, 1941 – August 10, 2020) was a Japanese actor. His career lasted from 1964 until his death. He was born in Awaji, Hyōgo. His best known roles were in Tokyo Drifter, Outlaw: Gangster VIP and Katsu Kaishū. His brother, Tsunehiko Watase, who was also an actor. Watari died of pneumonia on August 10, 2020 in Tokyo, aged 78. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Japanese movie actors Category:Japanese television actors Category:Japanese stage actors Category:Japanese voice actors Category:Deaths from pneumonia
title: Tetsuya Watari
